text: Welcome to 'This is My Architecture' New Zealand.
I'm Ondrej. I'm here with Shane from Consegna.
Hi, Ondrej, thanks very much for having us.

Can you tell me about Consegna
and the Digital Inteso Cloud?

Yes. So Consegna are a Premier
AWS consulting partner
and we help migrate people into AWS Cloud

so that they can start innovating
using the services there.
And what do we have here today?
Inteso is a digital human solution.

It uses an animated avatar
to interact with users

so that they are able
to do self-serve customer service.
How does the user interact with the avatar?

So what happens is they just use
a web capable device
like their mobile phone or laptop.
And when they interact with it,

it goes through our bot system
that's powered by Amazon Lambda.

And we utilize a third party UneeQ
that provides the animated digital human.

And how do you understand
what the user is saying to the avatar?

So what happens is that we use natural
language and natural speech services.

This is, one of them is Lex
that does speech-to-text recognition

and the other one is Polly
which does text-to-speech.

And we've even got
a New Zealand voice for Polly.

And this is part of the investment
AWS are making in New Zealand,

including standing up a Region
in New Zealand over the coming year.

Yeah, that's amazing
to see how you've been able

to implement different languages
and different accents as well.

So now when you understand
what the user is trying to achieve,
what do you do after that?
How do you start answering the questions?
So what happens is the Amazon Lex converts
the speech into text for us

and then we can send it out
to this OpenSearch service.
And the reason we use OpenSearch is

it's able to do very rapid searches
and give us responses back,

which are really important because
for this to be a human-like experience,

we need sub second processing back
through all of this platform.

I see. So you're able to get your responses
really quickly from OpenSearch?
Correct. Yeah.
What if you need a bit more detail?

So what we can do
then is there's another service
that Amazon provide called Kendra.
And what Kendra does is it allows us to use

existing knowledge bases
that we have on the customer

so frequently asked question,
knowledge base articles.
So we can then determine

is this person asking us something like,
"How do I use my email?"

And we can draw
on that knowledge base to again

be able to give them a response
and give them a good customer experience.

I see. So you can answer
really quickly as OpenSearch.
And then if you have more details, go to Kendra.

How many users have you seen
this being able to help?

So our monitoring shows us
that 90% to 95% of initial queries

are able to be responded
to using this solution.
It's amazing, but what if I'm that 5%.

I know I have always special questions
for you, Shane.
Sure.

The other great service
that we lean on here is Amazon Connect

which is the contact center solution
from Amazon so we're able to say,
"Hey, I couldn't quite find an answer for you

but I've got some colleagues
that might be able to help you.

Would you like a call back from them?"
and hooks us into the service agents.

They have the context of
the conversation because all of this is stored
so when they talk to the person

they don't have to ask
a whole lot of introductory questions
they've already answered.
They've got all that information.

So again the end result is just
a fantastic customer experience

when they're trying
to access information about our business.

I think it's really important
because when I'm talking to a representative

I certainly don't want
to be going through all the questions again.
Absolutely. Yeah, we've all done that
and that's not great and that was kind of

what the problem we were solving
with the Inteso product.

It's amazing
to see how you've been able to drive

a real difference in
the user interaction using combination

of machine learning
and serverless technology.
Thank you for sharing the architecture.
Yeah. Thanks for the opportunity to be here.

Thank you for watching
'This is My Architecture' New Zealand.
